People of Bengal look at BJP with new hope.  There is a superficial conflict between the Left, TMC and Congress in Bengal. Behind the curtains, they are allies.  They are fighting against BJP because we have tightened our grip on the corrupt leaders.  - PM @narendramodi

Do the people of West Bengal know that Mamata Banerjee does not let the welfare initiatives of the Central govt get implemented in Bengal?  Over the past 10 years, BJP govt has worked relentlessly for people, especially for Nari Shakti.   I urge you to enlist all the initiatives which don't reach the intended beneficiaries and make people aware of how Mamata Banerjee is responsible for their conditions.  - PM @narendramodi

During elections, in West Bengal, the biggest issue is of violence.   The Election Commission has made special arrangements for the security and safety of the people. We all also monitor the events that unfold in West Bengal.  You have to encourage people to vote fearlessly.  - PM @narendramodi

RBI can take the success of India to a global level. For any developing country, inflation control and GDP growth are unique necessities.  RBI can pioneer the world in this regard.   The entire global south will benefit a great deal from this.  - PM @narendramodi

UPI has become a globally recognised platform. It records over 1200 crore transactions every month.  In just 10 years, we have entered a new era of the banking sector, economy and currency exchange.   We have to deliberate more on the possibilities of digital transactions. We also have to monitor the channels of a cashless economy and ensure that we foster a financially inclusive culture.  - PM @narendramodi

You all know that the economy of the country and our GDP growth depend on the balance and correlation of monetary and fiscal policies.  In 2014, when I came for the 80th anniversary of RBI, the situation was grave. India's banking sector was struggling with many difficulties like that of NPAs. People were sceptical about the sector's growth. Public sector banks were not able to take care of the economic needs of the country.   Today, India's banking system is considered strong and sustainable. The system which was once on the verge of collapse is now making huge profits.  - PM @narendramodi

Why is PM Modi raking up an issue that was settled in 1974?   In 1974, Smt. Indira Gandhi's govt, in order to help lakhs of Tamils, negotiated with the Sri Lankan govt. Katchatheevu island was acknowledged as belonging to Sri Lanka. In return, 6 lakh Tamils were allowed to come to India. They've come here, their children and grandchildren are here, and they're breathing free air. The issue was closed 50 years ago.   Why is the PM raking up this matter instead of talking about important issues facing India today?  2,000 sq kms of Indian territory have been occupied by Chinese troops. Yet, the PM says no Chinese troops are present in Indian territory, and no part of Indian territory is under the occupation of Chinese troops, giving a clean chit to Beijing!  He should talk about what has happened in the last 2-3 years instead of what happened 50 years ago.   : Shri @PChidambaram_IN

We remember former Union Minister N. Gopalaswami Ayyangar. Having served as the Prime Minister of Kashmir in 1937, he was known to be an able administrator.   Ayyangar also represented India at the UN on the Kashmir issue. Today, we honour his legacy.

On her birth anniversary, we pay homage to Dr. Anandibai Joshi, considered to be one of India's first female physicians.   Being the first Indian woman to study and graduate in Western medicine, she continues to inspire generations of women to break the glass ceiling.

We pay tribute to the former Chief of the Army Staff and one of the most illustrious Indian Army officers, General K. S. Thimayya.  The Padma Bhushan awardee bravely led his men in the Indo-Pak war of 1947-48 and will always be remembered for his devoted service to the nation.
Congress party wishes you all a very happy Easter!  May the blessed occasion fill your lives with hope, love and harmony.

Comrade M. P. Munivenkatappa, the CPI(M) candidate for the Chikkaballapur Lok Sabha Constituency of Karnataka, filed nomination papers today in Chikkaballapura. Comrade U. Basavaraj, Secretary, Comrades Meenakshisundaram & S. Varalaxmi, Secretariat Members, and Comrade Dr. Anil Kumar, Chikkaballapura District Secretariat member, accompanied him. Polling in the constituency will be held on April 26th.  A procession was held from Vokalligara Bhavana to Vyapasandra, where a well-attended public meeting took place. CPIM Politburo member Comrade B. V. Raghavulu criticized the performance of the 10 years of Modi Government, which was filled with lies. In terms of policies and record of performance in defending interests and addressing problems of people of the constituency or state, both BJP and Congress have failed. Hence, he appealed to people to vote for CPI(M), which alone provided an alternative. Comrades M. P. Munivenkatappa, S. Varalaxmi, and Dr. Anil Kumar also spoke at the public meeting.  State Secretariat Members, District Secretaries of Bangalore South, North, Rural DCs, and other leaders were present at the Dias.  Comrade M. P. Munivenkatappa is currently the Secretary of the Chikkaballapura DC and Secretariat Member of the State Committee.

Stop Communalising Sainik Schools  The Polit Bureau of the Communist Party of India (Marxist) notes with deep concern the report that the BJP-led Union government has facilitated the participation of private players to run Sainik Schools in India.  Sainink Schools have been traditionally run by the autonomous Sainik School Society under the Ministry ofÂ  Defence. The Sainik Schools play an important role in nurturing students to get entry to the premiere National Defence Academy and the Indian Naval Academy. Eventually a substantial number of Sainik School pass outs occupy the higher echelons of Indiaâ€™s defence forces.  This new policy is just not about sharing finances and infrastructure on a PPP model. The schools that are entering into agreement with SSS and the government include a significant number of institutions with avowedly RSS and BJP links.  The Polit Bureau of the CPI(M) condemns this move which reinforces the trend of communalising education and potential for profoundly impacting the high secular standards of our military establishments. The Polit Bureau demands that the government must withdraw this move to ensure the national and secular character of the Sainik Schools is maintained.
Save Agriculture! Save Farmers and Agricultural Workers!! Defeat BJP!!! BJP Govt Policies Have Destroyed Rural Households
Data from the surveys of the National Sample Survey Office (NSSO) shows that about 41 per cent of the rural households did not own any agricultural land in 2018-19.

Save Agriculture! Save Farmers and Agricultural Workers!! Defeat BJP!!!  In sum, the growth of wage rates in rural areas virtually collapsed for all agricultural and non-agricultural occupations in the last nine years from 2014-15 to 2022-23. In real terms, wage rates for various agricultural occupations increased by less than ten to twelve rupees from 2014-15 to 2022-23. For majority of occupations, the growth in real wages was less than one per cent per annum between 2014-15 and 2022-23.

Meet Our Candidate:   MD Jahangir, born in 1970 in Munipampula village of Ramannapet mandal in Yadadribhuvanagiri District, emerged from humble beginnings to become a prominent figure in local politics. Joining the SFI student union during his college years, he quickly rose through the ranks, completing his education in Ramannapet and Hyderabad. Returning to his village, Jahangir embarked on a dynamic political journey, winning the position of Munipampula Gram Panchayat Sarpanch in 1995 at a remarkably young age. Concurrently, he galvanized youth activism as the secretary of the DYFI division, advocating against policies perceived as unjust by central and state governments.  As CPI(M) Party Divisional Secretary, Jahangir led numerous public struggles, from hunger strikes for housing sites to addressing local public issues in Nakirekal Constituency. Post the formation of Telangana state, he assumed the role of District Secretary of Yadadri Bhuvanagiri, where he tirelessly fought for public welfare. Organizing extensive yatras across 180 villages, Jahangir addressed critical local issues such as cultivation, drinking water, pollution, land, and unemployment. His advocacy extended to pressing matters like proper irrigation facilities, industrial pollution, and employment opportunities for local youth. Jahangir's leadership spearheaded mass protests and dharnas, resulting in tangible outcomes such as securing funds for pollution control measures and rehabilitation efforts under the Baswapur project. The CPI(M) stands firmly behind Jahangir, advocating for his candidacy for Parliament to continue his impactful contributions to constituency development.

West Bengal: Ground level electoral campaign activities of various CPI(M) candidates continues in the state. CPI(M) candidates are being warmly received by the common people everywhere. The candidates are advocating for the Left alternative, encouraging voters to support policies that prioritize people's interests and calling for the defeat of both TMC and BJP.  These are glimpses from our rallies and public interactions, being carried out by CPI(M) candidates comrades, SM Sadi, Md Salim, Srijan Bhattacharya, Manadip Ghosh, Biplab Kumar Mitra and Sujan Chakraborty who are contesting from Krishnanagar, Murshidabad, Jadavpur, Hooghly, Arambag and Dum Dum Lok Sabha constituencies, respectively.

Thousands of marching, enthusiastic women took over the town in a historic womenâ€™s show of support to Sailaja and the LDF. Kannur Youth-Student Convention and Interaction Pledges Support to LDF supported CPI(M) candidate MV Jairajan.   At a packed auditorium of youth and students, organised by the LDF Youth Student Alliance - PBM Brinda Karat spoke on the 2024 elections and challenges we face and the big role that Kerala is playing in this battle.  It was followed by Q&A session. The enthusiastic anticipation was followed by the release of a video song by comrade PK Srimati.

Meet Our Candidate  Comrade R Sachithanandam, aged 53, holds the esteemed positions of state committee member and district secretary of the Dindigul district committee. With a B Sc degree under his belt, he has been a steadfast member of the party for 37 years, serving as a whole-timer for 30 years. His political journey commenced as the district joint secretary of SFI in 1987, followed by an impressive tenure of 8 years as the district secretary of DYFI. Transitioning to a prominent role, he served as the district secretary of AIKS from 2007 to 2018 before he was elected the district secretary of the party in 2018.  Remarkably, Comrade Sachithanandam was elected as the panchayat president of Kamatchipuram panchayat at the tender age of 26, where he served diligently for a decade from 1996 to 2006. Throughout his tenure, he has been a fervent advocate for farmers' land reclamation struggles in Pazhani taluk and has spearheaded movements for securing Scheduled Tribe status for the Pulayan community people residing in the Kodaikanal hills.

Meet Our Candidate  Comrade Su Venkatesan, aged 54, has been an integral part of the party for 34 years, dedicating himself as a whole-timer for the past 33 years. As an esteemed recipient of the Sahitya Academy award, he holds the honorary presidency of the Tamil Nadu Progressive Writers and Artists Association.  During his five-year tenure, Comrade Venkatesan spearheaded various initiatives, including the distribution of Rs 500 crores in education loans for students and advocating for benefits for over 20,000 differently-abled individuals. He played a pivotal role in significant projects such as the Keezhadi excavation, AIIMS establishment in Madurai, and airport expansion. Additionally, he directed MPLADS funds towards critical sectors like health, education, and drinking water, leaving a profound impact on the community.

Comrade Sitaram Yechury addressed thousands at #INDIAAlliance #Maharally , expressed solidarity with Sunita Kejriwal and Kalpana Soren
#INDIAAlliance #Maharally - Thousands pledge to defeat #BJP

Hyderabad: Left Parties' Convention conducted at Sundarayya Vijnana Kendram. It was presided by CPI(M) Telangana State Secretariat Member DG Narasimharao. MLA & CPI Telangana State Secretary Kunamneni Samba Siva Rao, CPI(M) Telangana Secretariat Member S Verayya and other left party leaders participated and addressed the convention.The convention resolved to defeat the Modi-BJP government in the upcoming election.

West Bengal: CPI(M) candidates are laying most focus on door-to-door interaction during electoral campaigns. These are the campaign trails of comrades Sukriti Ghosal, Jahanara Khan and Shyamali Pradhan who are contesting from Bardhaman-Durgapur, Asansol and Bolpur Lok Sabha constituencies, respectively.
Thousands pariticipate in INDIA Bloc Maharally at Ramlila Maidan, New Delhi.

Comrade Brinda Karat, Polit Bureau Member of the CPI(M) at the Maharally expressing solidarity with Sunita Kejriwal and Kalpana Soren - wives of arrested sitting CM of Delhi Arvind Kejriwal and arrested former CM of Jharkhand Hemant Soren, respectively.

#WATCH | Lucknow: Dr Pallavi Patel's Apna Dal (Kamerawadi) and AIMIM led by Asaduddin Owaisi announce alliance, in Uttar Pradesh. Other parties like Premchand Bind's Pragatisheel Manav Samaj Party and Rashtriya Uday Party are also included in the alliance.
